ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
Appose is a library for interprocess cooperation with shared memory.
The guiding principles are simplicity and efficiency.
Appose was written to enable easy execution of Python-based deep learning
from Java without copying tensors, but its utility extends beyond that.

Appose is a library for interprocess cooperation with shared memory.
The guiding principles are simplicity and efficiency.
Appose was written to enable easy execution of Python-based deep learning
from Java without copying tensors, but its utility extends beyond that.

name: appose
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set python_min = "3.9" %}
{% set name = "appose" %}
{% set version = "0.7.2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e423b513ed0b8796edc8e575580a35f42f72b714b8b3e367546b80f37cef8628

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vvv --no-deps
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - setuptools >=61.2
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}

test:
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
  imports:
    - appose

about:
  home: https://github.com/apposed/appose-python
  summary: Interprocess cooperation with shared memory.
  description: |
    Appose is a library for interprocess cooperation with shared memory.
    The guiding principles are simplicity and efficiency.
    Appose was written to enable easy execution of Python-based deep learning
    from Java without copying tensors, but its utility extends beyond that.
  license: BSD-2-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  doc_url: https://github.com/apposed/appose
  dev_url: https://github.com/apposed/appose-python

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ctrueden
